verses.verse: Now <WG1161> after <WG3326> this <WG3778> the Lord <WG2962> appointed <WG322> seventy <WG1440> others, <WG2087> and sent <WG649> them two <WG1417> and two <WG1417> ahead <WG4253> <WG4383> of Him to every <WG3956> city <WG4172> and place <WG5117> where <WG3757> He Himself <WG846> was going <WG3195> to come. <WG2064>

And He was saying <WG3004> to them, "The harvest <WG2326> is plentiful, <WG4183> but the laborers <WG2040> are few; <WG3641> therefore <WG3767> beseech <WG1189> the Lord <WG2962> of the harvest <WG2326> to send <WG1544> out laborers <WG2040> into His harvest. <WG2326>
"Go <WG5217> your ways; <WG5217> behold, <WG2400> I send <WG649> you out as lambs <WG704> in the midst <WG3319> of wolves. <WG3074>
"Carry <WG941> no <WG3361> purse, <WG905> no <WG3361> bag, <WG4082> no <WG3361> shoes; <WG5266> and greet <WG782> no <WG3367> one <WG3367> on the way. <WG3598>
"And whatever <WG3739> <WG302> house <WG3614> you enter, <WG1525> first <WG4413> say, <WG3004> 'Peace <WG1515> [be] to this <WG3778> house. <WG3624>'
"And if <WG1437> a man <WG5207> of peace <WG1515> is there, <WG1563> your peace <WG1515> will rest <WG1879> upon him; but if <WG1487> not, it will return <WG344> to you.

"And stay <WG3306> in that house, <WG3614> eating <WG2068> and drinking <WG4095> what they give <WG3844> you; for the laborer <WG2040> is worthy <WG514> of his wages. <WG3408> Do not keep moving <WG3327> from house <WG3614> to house. <WG3614>
"And whatever <WG3739> <WG302> city <WG4172> you enter, <WG1525> and they receive <WG1209> you, eat <WG2068> what is set <WG3908> before <WG3908> you;
and heal <WG2323> those <WG3588> in it who are sick, <WG772> and say <WG3004> to them, 'The kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> has come <WG1448> near <WG1448> to you.'
"But whatever <WG3739> <WG302> city <WG4172> you enter <WG1525> and they do not receive <WG1209> you, go <WG1831> out into its streets <WG4116> and say, <WG3004>

'Even <WG2532> the dust <WG2868> of your city <WG4172> which clings <WG2853> to our feet, <WG4228> we wipe <WG631> off <WG631> [in protest] against you; yet <WG4133> be sure <WG1097> of this, <WG3778> that the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> has come <WG1448> near. <WG1448>'
"I say <WG3004> to you, it will be more <WG414> tolerable <WG414> in that day <WG2250> for Sodom, <WG4670> than <WG2228> for that city. <WG4172>

"Woe <WG3759> to you, Chorazin! <WG5523> Woe <WG3759> to you, Bethsaida! <WG966> For if <WG1487> the miracles <WG1411> had been performed <WG1096> in Tyre <WG5184> and Sidon <WG4605> which <WG3739> occurred <WG1096> in you, they would have repented <WG3340> long <WG3819> ago, <WG3819> sitting <WG2521> in sackcloth <WG4526> and ashes. <WG4700>
"But it will be more <WG414> tolerable <WG414> for Tyre <WG5184> and Sidon <WG4605> in the judgment, <WG2920> than <WG2228> for you.
"And you, Capernaum, <WG2746> will not be exalted <WG5312> to heaven, <WG3772> will you? You will be brought <WG2597> down <WG2597> to Hades! <WG86>
"The one who listens <WG191> to you listens <WG191> to Me, and the one who rejects <WG114> you rejects <WG114> Me; and he who rejects <WG114> Me rejects <WG114> the One who sent <WG649> Me."
And the seventy <WG1440> returned <WG5290> with joy, <WG5479> saying, <WG3004> "Lord, <WG2962> even <WG2532> the demons <WG1140> are subject <WG5293> to us in Your name. <WG3686>"
And He said <WG3004> to them, "I was watching <WG2334> Satan <WG4567> fall <WG4098> from heaven <WG3772> like <WG5613> lightning <WG796>.

"Behold, <WG2400> I have given <WG1325> you authority <WG1849> to tread <WG3961> upon serpents <WG3789> and scorpions, <WG4651> and over <WG1909> all <WG3956> the power <WG1411> of the enemy, <WG2190> and nothing <WG3762> shall injure <WG91> you.

"Nevertheless <WG4133> do not rejoice <WG5463> in this, <WG3778> that the spirits <WG4151> are subject <WG5293> to you, but rejoice <WG5463> that your names <WG3686> are recorded <WG1449> in heaven. <WG3772>"

At that very <WG846> time <WG5610> He rejoiced <WG21> greatly <WG21> in the Holy <WG40> Spirit, <WG4151> and said, <WG3004> "I praise <WG1843> Thee, O Father, <WG3962> Lord <WG2962> of heaven <WG3772> and earth, <WG1093> that Thou didst hide <WG613> these <WG3778> things <WG3778> from [the] wise <WG4680> and intelligent <WG4908> and didst reveal <WG601> them to babes. <WG3516> Yes, <WG3483> Father, <WG3962> for thus <WG3779> it was well-pleasing in Thy sight. <WG1715>

"All <WG3956> things <WG3956> have been handed <WG3860> over <WG3860> to Me by My Father, <WG3962> and no <WG3762> one <WG3762> knows <WG1097> who <WG5101> the Son <WG5207> is except <WG1508> the Father, <WG3962> and who <WG5101> the Father <WG3962> is except <WG1508> the Son, <WG5207> and anyone to whom <WG3739> the Son <WG5207> wills <WG1014> to reveal <WG601> [Him.]"
And turning <WG4762> to the disciples, <WG3101> He said <WG3004> privately, <WG2596> <WG2398> "Blessed <WG3107> [are] the eyes <WG3788> which see <WG991> the things you see, <WG991>

for I say <WG3004> to you, that many <WG4183> prophets <WG4396> and kings <WG935> wished <WG2309> to see <WG3708> the things which <WG3739> you see, <WG991> and did not see <WG3708> [them,] and to hear <WG191> the things which <WG3739> you hear, <WG191> and did not hear <WG191> [them.] "

And behold, <WG2400> a certain <WG5100> lawyer <WG3544> stood <WG450> up and put <WG1598> Him to the test, <WG1598> saying, <WG3004> "Teacher, <WG1320> what <WG5101> shall I do <WG4160> to inherit <WG2816> eternal <WG166> life <WG2222>?"
And He said <WG3004> to him, "What <WG5101> is written <WG1125> in the Law <WG3551>? How <WG4459> does it read <WG314> to you?"

And he answered <WG611> and said, <WG3004> "You shall love <WG25> the Lord <WG2962> your God <WG2316> with all <WG3650> your heart, <WG2588> and with all <WG3650> your soul, <WG5590> and with all <WG3650> your strength, <WG2479> and with all <WG3650> your mind; <WG1271> and your neighbor <WG4139> as yourself. <WG4572>"
And He said <WG3004> to him, "You have answered <WG611> correctly; <WG3723> do <WG4160> this, <WG3778> and you will live. <WG2198>"
But wishing <WG2309> to justify <WG1344> himself, <WG1438> he said <WG3004> to Jesus, <WG2424> "And who <WG5101> is my neighbor <WG4139>?"

Jesus <WG2424> replied <WG5274> and said, <WG3004> "A certain <WG5100> man <WG444> was going <WG2597> down <WG2597> from Jerusalem <WG2419> to Jericho; <WG2410> and he fell <WG4045> among <WG4045> robbers, <WG3027> and they stripped <WG1562> him and beat <WG2007> <WG4127> him, and went <WG565> off <WG565> leaving <WG863> him half <WG2253> dead. <WG2253>

"And by chance <WG4795> a certain <WG5100> priest <WG2409> was going <WG2597> down <WG2597> on that road, <WG3598> and when he saw <WG3708> him, he passed <WG492> by on the other <WG492> side. <WG492>
"And likewise <WG3668> a Levite <WG3019> also, <WG2532> when he came <WG2064> to the place <WG5117> and saw <WG3708> him, passed <WG492> by on the other <WG492> side. <WG492>
"But a certain <WG5100> Samaritan, <WG4541> who was on a journey, <WG3593> came <WG2064> upon him; and when he saw <WG3708> him, he felt <WG4697> compassion, <WG4697>

and came <WG4334> to him, and bandaged <WG2611> up his wounds, <WG5134> pouring <WG2022> oil <WG1637> and wine <WG3631> on [them;] and he put <WG1913> him on his own <WG2398> beast, <WG2934> and brought <WG71> him to an inn, <WG3829> and took <WG1959> care <WG1959> of him.

"And on the next <WG839> day <WG839> he took <WG1544> out two <WG1417> denarii <WG1220> and gave <WG1325> them to the innkeeper <WG3830> and said, <WG3004> 'Take <WG1959> care <WG1959> of him; and whatever <WG3739> <WG5100> <WG302> more <WG4325> you spend, <WG4325> when <WG1722> I return, <WG1880> I will repay <WG591> you.'
"Which <WG5101> of these <WG3778> three <WG5140> do you think <WG1380> proved <WG1096> to be a neighbor <WG4139> to the man who fell <WG1706> into the robbers' [hands?]"
And he said, <WG3004> "The one who showed <WG4160> mercy <WG1656> toward <WG3326> him." And Jesus <WG2424> said <WG3004> to him, "Go <WG4198> and do <WG4160> the same. <WG3668>"

Now <WG1161> as they were traveling <WG4198> along, He entered <WG1525> a certain <WG5100> village; <WG2968> and a woman <WG1135> named <WG3686> Martha <WG3136> welcomed <WG5264> Him into her home. <WG3614>
And she had <WG1510> a sister <WG79> called <WG2564> Mary, <WG3137> who <WG3739> moreover <WG2532> was listening <WG191> to the Lord's word, <WG3056> seated <WG3869> at His feet. <WG4228>

But Martha <WG3136> was distracted <WG4049> with all <WG4183> her preparations; <WG1248> and she came <WG2186> up [to Him,] and said, <WG3004> "Lord, <WG2962> do You not care <WG3199> that my sister <WG79> has left <WG2641> me to do <WG1247> all the serving <WG1247> alone <WG3441>? Then <WG3767> tell <WG3004> her to help <WG4878> me."
But the Lord <WG2962> answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to her, "Martha, <WG3136> Martha, <WG3136> you are worried <WG3309> and bothered <WG7093> about <WG4012> so many <WG4183> things; <WG4183>

but [only] a few <WG3641> things <WG3641> are necessary, <WG5532> really <WG2228> [only] one, <WG1520> for Mary <WG3137> has chosen <WG1586> the good <WG18> part, <WG3310> which <WG3748> shall not be taken <WG851> away <WG851> from her. "
